Evaluation_Questions: How well did this course, to the extent promised in the syllabus, enable “conversation across lines of difference,” integrate practical and theoretical concerns, or consider and integrate issues of class, gender/sexuality, race/ethnicity, dis/ability, and or global/cultural diversity
Comments_Questions: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your Teaching Fellow as an instructor and how might his/her teaching be improved
What was the name of your practicum instructor
What were her/his strengths or weaknesses
Comments_List: Justin did a great job making sure our class learned the different doctrines. He was incredibly patient with us and gave great feedback on our papers.
Tendency to combat arguments with information that is not found in the readings. Overall very smart individual.

Sara is honesty the best TF Ive ever had. She was exceedingly well prepared and her emails ahead of section kept us all well prepared too. She is encouraging, concerned for all, upbeat, and deeply knowledgeable about the material. I imagine she will make a splendid professor before long!

Strengths - compassionate and resourceful
Weaknesses - none

Organized and thorough. Gave us space to investigate our own questions. 
Great theological analysis worksheet. Helped us study for the final. 
Considerate and prepared. She was Aleshas way more prepared for the class than needed. Ready to answer an array of questions. 

The section sizes should be maxed at 10.

Sara really knew her stuff and taught us a lot! She was a tough grader on the first case study, but she definitely helped me improve and I learned so much during the course. She clarified a ton for me!
Justin Hawkins
Justin Hawkins
Justin Hawkins
Sara Misgen
Justin Hawkins.
Sara Misgen

Justin was incredibly insightful, helpful, and offered critical feedback in a supportive manner.

His discussion questions were thought provoking and forced us to integrate our knowledge and thinking.

I am glad that Justin was assigned to this class, and I think future students will benefit from his leadership and teaching.

Justin comes prepared. His classroom management skills are excellent. He has material ready to lead a discussion. There is no dead air time. Further, he has answers to student questions and makes space for differing opinions. While he is still maturing in his pedagogy and theology, he is very knowledgeable and is able to argue the basic and advanced theological rhetoric. He is skilled at seeing how the pieces connect if one argument is skewed where does another move. He is respectful of each student and there various outside obligations and was helpful when I needed accommodations. He respected the dignity of each participant. Well done!!
Justin was well prepared. Invited questions and knew the subject matter very well.

I have to say that without Justin this class would have been much harder. He did "fill in the gaps" of knowledge left by the lectures and worked in the sections to provide more structure so we could understand better the course material. I am grateful to have had him as a TA and I am sure he is on for a bright future as a professor and a theologian.
Very well versed in systems.

Sara is a kind and thoughtful TF.  She is eager to help lead students and facilitate learning appropriate to each student.  I would add that I think she should add some more teaching elements to the sessions.  While facilitating is great, some subjects required straight-up teaching to help clarify lecture.  I appreciated her positive and welcoming tone.
Great at facilitating class discussion. Very engaging.

I cannot speak highly enough about Sara. I felt as though she organized, challenged and supported where appropriate our section in the best way possible. She was attentive to the details of our theological points and encouraged us to fine tune them our walk through the implications of a statement wed said more closely. She worked to foster a respectful, inclusive and supportive classroom environment in a meaningful and intentional waynot because she had to but because it was important to do so, which you could tell in the way she talked about it. She was easy to schedule meetings with outside of section and quick to respond to emails if I had a question. Sara is awesome and Im very thankful to have had her this semester!!!
